description.p: Rounds are used in muskets, flintlock pistols, pepperboxes, arquebuses, and wheellock guns. Piercing.
Rifled rounds are used in rifles, carbines, and pistols. Piercing.
Scatter rounds are used in shotguns and blunderbusses. Bludgeoning.
Slugs are used in shotguns. Removes the scatter property - functions like Rifled rounds.
Ammunition (range 30/90), Loading, Light, Misfire 3
Ammunition (range 10/30), Loading, Scatter (1d4), Misfire 3
Ammunition (range 40/120), Reload 4, Shell Loading, Misfire 1
Ammunition (range 70/200), Two-Handed, Loading, Misfire 2

element.name: Double Barrel Shotgun
element.supports: ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_FIREARM,ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_MARTIAL_RANGED,ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_RANGED, ID_INTERNAL_AAGNG_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL_FIREARM, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGETYPE_BLUDGEONING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_AMMUNITION, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_LOADING, ID_INTERNAL_AAGNG_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SCATTER, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_TWOHANDED, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_LONGARMS, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL_DOUBLE_BARREL_SHOTGUN

description.p: Ammunition (range 90/300), Two-Handed, Scatter (1d8) Loading

Double Barrel shotguns can be fired twice per attack. When you make an attack roll with a double barrel shotgun, you can make two attack rolls at the same creature. The second attack roll is made with disadvantage, and on a hit, you do not add your ability score modifier to the damage of that attack, unless your modifier is negative.

sheet.description: Double Barrel shotguns can be fired twice per attack. When you make an attack roll with a double barrel shotgun, you can make two attack rolls at the same creature. The second attack roll is made with disadvantage, and on a hit, you do not add your ability score modifier to the damage of that attack, unless your modifier is negative.

element.name: Anti-Material Rifle

element.name: Shoulder Cannon
element.supports: ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_FIREARM,ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_MARTIAL_RANGED,ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_RANGED, ID_INTERNAL_AAGNG_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL_FIREARM, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGETYPE_BLUDGEONING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_AMMUNITION, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_LOADING, ID_INTERNAL_AAGNG_WEAPON_PROPERTY_BULKY, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_TWOHANDED, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_LONGARMS, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL_SHOULDER_CANNON

description.p: Ammunition (range 200), Two-Handed, Loading, Bulky, Special

You can make a special attack with a Shoulder Cannon that targets any creature within a 5 wide foot line out to their maximum range. Any target in the path of this special attack must succeed a DC (8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus) Strength saving throw or take it's damage roll and be knocked prone. They take half damage on a success and are not knocked prone. Shoulder Cannons are considered siege weapons for the purposes of damage.

sheet.description: You can make a special attack with a Shoulder Cannon that targets any creature within a 5 wide foot line out to their maximum range. Any target in the path of this special attack must succeed a DC (8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus) Strength saving throw or take it's damage roll and be knocked prone. They take half damage on a success and are not knocked prone. Shoulder Cannons are considered siege weapons for the purposes of damage.

description.p: Ammunition (range 90/300), Two-Handed, Reload 6, Bayonet (1d6 Piercing/Slashing)
Ammunition (range 70/230), Two-Handed, Long Load 6, Bayonet (1d12 Piercing, Reach), Special
You have disadvantage when you use the lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. You can wield the lance one handed when mounted.

sheet.description: You have disadvantage when you use the lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. You can wield the lance one handed when mounted.

element.name: Nock Gun
element.supports: ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_FIREARM,ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_MARTIAL_RANGED,ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_RANGED, ID_INTERNAL_AAGNG_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL_FIREARM, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGETYPE_PIERCING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_AMMUNITION, ID_INTERNAL_AAGNG_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SHELL_LOADING, ID_INTERNAL_AAGNG_WEAPON_PROPERTY_BULKY, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_TWOHANDED, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_LONGARMS, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL_NOCK_GUN

description.p: Ammunition (range 70/210), Two-Handed, Shell Loading 7, Bulky, Special

You can use your action to fire all 7 barrels of this gun at once. Make an attack roll with disadvantage. If you succeed, roll 7d12 piercing damage. This attack deals 7d4 bludgeoning damage to you and forces you to make a DC 10 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

sheet.description: You can use your action to fire all 7 barrels of this gun at once. Make an attack roll with disadvantage. If you succeed, roll 7d12 piercing damage. This attack deals 7d4 bludgeoning damage to you and forces you to make a DC 10 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

description.p: Firearms can now have attachments placed on the rail.
Increases the normal and maximum range of the firearm by 10 feet.
Increases the normal and maximum range of the firearm by 30 feet.
+1 to damage rolls at creatures within 30 feet.
Advantage on ability checks to resist being disarmed/impose disadvantage on disarming strikes.
+1 to attack rolls when prone or behind half-cover.

Adds a melee weapon to the barrel of the gun. You are not considered proficient in melee attacks made with this bayonet unless you are proficient with improvised weapons. You cannot have a Barrel or Bottom attachment when you have this attachment equipped.
You can use a bonus action to mark a creature with the beam and reroll 1s and 2s to all damage rolls until the end of your turn.
Adds a magic torch that can be turned on and off as a bonus action. It sheds bright light in a 30 foot cone and dim light in a 30 foot cone.
Grants the benefits of a Telescopic Sight and a Glowing Dot Sight. You must switch between them as a bonus action to get each one's bonuses.

When you make an attack roll with this firearm while hidden, each creature in a 30 foot radius must make a Wisdom(Perception) check. The DC of this check is 10 + (attack roll result) / 5. You are still considered hidden to any creature that fails the check, even if other creatures succeed.
Functions exactly like theSuppressorcustom part, except the DC of the Wisdom(Perception) check is 10 + (attack roll result) / 2, and the radius is 10 feet.
Advantage on the first attack roll you make within 30 feet of you if you use a bonus action to brace the firearm against your shoulder.
+1 to attack rolls.
Increases the normal range of the gun by 20 feet and the maximum range by 20 feet. This cannot be combined with Light Barrel.
Reduce the normal range of the gun by 5 feet and the maximum range by 10 feet. This cannot be combined with Heavy Barrel.
Add your ability score modifier to your firearm's scatter damage. This cannot be combined with Wide Choke Barrel
The range for your firearm's Scatter damage roll is now 10 feet around the original target. This cannot be combined with Tight Choke Barrel

Removes the two-handedproperty from the shotgun and changes its classification to sidearm. Lowers the damage die and scatter damage die by one category. (For example, a d12 die lowers to a d10.) Reduces the shotgun's normal and maximum range by 10.

Increases the ammunition count of longarmsby 6, and increases the reload count of sidearmsby 8. If firearm has the loadingproperty, it loses that property and gains the reloadproperty instead. (6 rounds for longarms, 8 rounds for sidearms.)

element.name: Rifling
element.prerequisite: Muskets, Flintlock Pistols, Arquebuses, Wheellock Guns

p.em: Prerequisite: Muskets, Flintlock Pistols, Arquebuses, Wheellock Guns

description.p: +30 normal range, +10 max range. Weapon now uses rifled bullets instead of round bullets. Some firearms have this built in inherently.
Gun's weight cannot decrease past 1 lb.
Turns firearm into Burst Rifle
Turns the firearm into Automatic Rifle or Automatic Pistol.

element.name: Recoil Compensator
element.prerequisite: Firearms with the Automatic or Burst Fire Property

p.em: Prerequisite: Firearms with the Automatic or Burst Fire Property

description.p: You can add your Dexterity modifier to your Automatic and Burst Fire damage.

Firearms with the scatter property have two types of damage, a regular damage roll and a scatter damage roll. When you make an attack roll with one of these guns against a creature, compare your attack roll to the AC of all creatures within 5 feet of the target. If your attack would hit them, deal the firearm's scatter damage roll to the creatures. You do not add your ability score modifier to the damage of this attack, unless that modifier is negative.

Automatic firearms can make a separate attack that releases a salvo of bullets per pull of the trigger. As an action, you can force any creatures of your choice in a 25-foot square centered on a point within your gun's maximum range to make a Dexterity saving throw, taking the gun's automatic damage (listed in parenthesis) on a failed save, and half that damage on a success. This action subtracts rounds from your gun equal to the number of creatures affected.
Additionally, guns with the automatic property always expend six rounds per attack.

center.p: Automatic save DC (Proficient) = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier

description.p: Burst fire firearms are able to make a special attack that releases a stream of multiple bullets. As an action, you can force up to 6 creatures of your choice in a 15-foot square centered on a point within your gun's maximum range to make a Dexterity saving throw, taking your gun's burst fire damage (listed in parenthesis) on a failed save, and half that damage on a success. This action subtracts rounds from your gun equal to the number of creatures affected, to a maximum of 6.
Additionally, guns with the burst fire property always expend 3 rounds per attack.

center.p: Burst Fire save DC (Proficient) = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier

description.p: Firearms and ranged weapons with the bulky property have to be made stable in order to be fired effectively due to their weight and the damage they can put out with a single shot. You cannot attack more than once during your turn while wielding a bulky firearm.
This rule is made only for games where firearms are prominent, and you wish to emphasize inferiority of Primitive Firearms. These rules only apply to them in this instance.

If you make an attack roll and the roll matches or is lower than a firearm's misfire number, (such as 2, for example), your gun jams. You cannot make an attack with it again until you spend an action to clear the chamber. Your firearm's misfire number then goes up by 1, to a maximum of 10. You can spend 1 minute and make a DC 10 + your gun's misfire number Dexterity(Tinker's tools) or Intelligence(Tinker's tools) check to reduce your gun's misfire number by 1, to a minimum of its original misfire number.

In games where firearms are prominent, you can use this optional rule. Primitive Firearms with the loading property are not properly built for combat. If you make more than two attacks with these weapons, the firearm's misfire number goes up by 1, to a maximum of 10.

Some ranged weapons can be fired a number of times before they must be reloaded. Ranged weapons with the reload property take a bonus action to reload its ammunition. Ranged weapons with the long load property take an action to reload its ammunition.
If you wield two light ranged weapons with the reload property, you can reload them both at once as an action during your turn.

If you are wielding a light ranged weapon with the reload property in one hand and have your hand occupied by something other than another light ranged weapon with the reload property, the ranged weapon takes an action to reload.

Some ranged weapons can be fired a number of times before they must be reloaded. Ranged weapons with the reload property take a bonus action to reload its ammunition. Ranged weapons with the long load property take an action to reload its ammunition.
If you wield two light ranged weapons with the reload property, you can reload them both at once as an action during your turn.

If you are wielding a light ranged weapon with the reload property in one hand and have your hand occupied by something other than another light ranged weapon with the reload property, the ranged weapon takes an action to reload.

Firearms with the shell loading property require you to reload your gun by inserting each piece of ammunition in at a time. As a bonus action, you can reload three pieces of ammunition into the weapon on your turn. Alternatively, you can spend an action during your turn to reload every piece of ammunition into the gun at once.
